channel.title: PotentialFieldControlFinder
channel.description:
A compromise - I'll go ahead and release this, but only in the form of transformer source. It is my desire that those who use this know how to compile and integrate it themselves (i.e., mopar dont add it to your one-click deob thing just yet please). I still really want to keep the numbers down right now. The less Jagex notices that we have compilable source again, the better.
It works for the current client and I think it will work in general...but if it doesn't I have another way I guess I could try. We'll just have to see at the next update.
edit: source posted long enough. if you still want/need it then PM me

Anyway, the above code was wrong as well...I made some last minute changes and forgot to fix a line...so I changed that now.

item.title: PotentialFieldControlFinder
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Lol, yeah...way off topic.

But getting back on topic, I tested this some more, and it seems to work fine with the previous client versions. So here's the modified PotentialFieldControlFinder:

package org.saev.deob.trans.pred;
import org.saev.deob.Application;
import org.saev.deob.util.FieldID;
import java.util.*;
import org.apache.bcel.classfile.*;
import org.apache.bcel.generic.*;
import org.apache.bcel.util.*;
public class PotentialFieldControlFinder implements ControlFinder {
	private static final boolean DEBUG = true;
	private Set<FieldID> fieldSet;
	private ArrayList<FieldID> potentialControlFields;
	private FieldID mainField = null;
	public PotentialFieldControlFinder(Application app) {		
		for(Iterator<ClassGen> classIt = app.getClasses().iterator(); classIt.hasNext(); ) {
            ClassGen currentClass = classIt.next();
            ClassPoolGen pool = currentClass.getConstantPool();
    		for(int i = 0; i < pool.getSize(); i++) {
			Constant c = pool.getConstant(i);
			ConstantPool cp = pool.getConstantPool();
			if(!(c instanceof ConstantFieldref)) {
				continue;
			}
			ConstantFieldref cfr = (ConstantFieldref)c;
			ConstantNameAndType cnat = (ConstantNameAndType) pool.getConstant(cfr.getNameAndTypeIndex());
			if(cnat.getSignature(cp).equals("Z") && !cfr.getClass(cp).equals(currentClass.getClassName())) {
				if(potentialControlFields == null) {
					potentialControlFields = new ArrayList<FieldID>();
				}
				potentialControlFields.add(new FieldID(cnat.getName(cp), cnat.getSignature(cp), cfr.getClass(cp)));
			}
		}
    }
	
	if(DEBUG) {
		System.out.println("potentials = " + potentialControlFields);
	}
	
	for(Iterator<ClassGen> classIt = app.getClasses().iterator(); classIt.hasNext(); ) {
		ClassGen cgen = classIt.next();			
		Method[] methods = cgen.getMethods();
		final String className = cgen.getClassName();
		final ConstantPoolGen cpg = cgen.getConstantPool();
		
		for(int i = 0; i < methods.length; i++) {	
			MethodGen mg = new MethodGen(methods[i], className, cpg);
			InstructionList il = mg.getInstructionList();
			try {
				Iterator<InstructionHandle[]> matchIt =						
					new InstructionFinder(il).search("GETSTATIC IFEQ ((IINC ILOAD) | (ILOAD IFEQ ICONST GOTO ICONST)) PUTSTATIC",
					new InstructionFinder.CodeConstraint() {
					
					public boolean checkCode(InstructionHandle[] match) {
						for(int i = 0; i < match.length; i++) {
							if(!(match[i].getInstruction() instanceof FieldInstruction))
								continue;
							FieldInstruction fi = (FieldInstruction) match[i].getInstruction();
							FieldID fid = new FieldID(fi.getName(cpg), fi.getSignature(cpg), fi.getClassName(cpg));
			
							if(potentialControlFields.contains(fid)) {
								mainField = fid;
								if(DEBUG) {
									System.out.println("main field = " + mainField);
								}
								return true;
							}
						}
						return false;
					}
				});	
				while(matchIt.hasNext()) {
					InstructionHandle[] match = matchIt.next();
					FieldInstruction fi = (FieldInstruction) match[match.length - 1].getInstruction();
			
					if(fieldSet == null) {
						fieldSet = new HashSet<FieldID>();
					}
					FieldID fid = new FieldID(fi.getName(cpg), fi.getSignature(cpg), fi.getClassName(cpg));
					fieldSet.add(fid);
					
					if(DEBUG) {
						System.out.println("field = " + fid);
					}
				}	
			} catch (NullPointerException npe) {}
		}			
	}
	if(mainField == null) {
		//throw new RuntimeException("could not find control field");
	}
}
	
public boolean containsField(FieldID fid) {
	return fieldSet.contains(fid);
}
	
public FieldID getControlField() {
		return mainField;
}
}

Read full topic

Â°Â° Well it's come to our attention that      Â°Â°
Â°Â° our previous "proper" release wasnt 100%  Â°Â°
Â°Â° proper as we thought. This release fixes  Â°Â°
Â°Â° the steam connection error and contains   Â°Â°
Â°Â° the recent update (Nov 25) from Steam.    Â°Â°
Â°Â°                                           Â°Â°
Â°Â° There is only one known issue with this   Â°Â°
Â°Â° release and thats the 'elevator bug'.     Â°Â°
Â°Â° (Fuck all your guys shit, this is AHU's   Â°Â°
Â°Â° own fix and were sticking with it)        Â°Â°
Â°Â° To get past the elevator bug simply save  Â°Â°
Â°Â° inside the elevator and then load. If     Â°Â°
Â°Â° this doesnt work for you , type this in   Â°Â°
Â°Â° console ,ai_norebuildgraph 0, and reload  Â°Â°
Â°Â° your game.                                Â°Â°
Â°Â°               		                 Â°Â°
Â°Â° This is the last time were doing this     Â°Â°
Â°Â° (releasing HL2 full). Every future        Â°Â°
Â°Â° related release will be a UPDATE.         Â°Â°
Â°Â°               		                 Â°Â°
Â°Â° The only reason why were releasing it     Â°Â°
Â°Â° AGAIN is cuz we've included the steam     Â°Â°
Â°Â° update and eliminated the steam           Â°Â°
Â°Â° connection error and were HOPING that it  Â°Â°
Â°Â° wont be nuked this time. SFV/NFO Incl now Â°Â°

item.title: PotentialFieldControlFinder
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

moparisthebest:

[quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=3436.msg41255#msg41255 date=1149041924]
As for why it stopped working, I don't know...I'm too busy trying to bypass Steam in order to play a legitimate copy of Half Life 2 on my no-inet computer to bother debugging a transformer at the moment. Valve sucks - why 'protect' your game to the point where it's nonfunctional?

yea I hate valve too, thats why I dont buy thier games, I dl them for free try a cracked version of hl2?[/quote]

I've tried about 3 cracks and an 'offline installer' but none of them get around the fact that hl2.exe tries to call some Steam functions, which of course default to int3 breakpoints because STEAM WON'T START without internet. I try running the game and it brings up an error asking me if I want to
A) JIT debug it
B) Send error report
C) Don't send error report

When I debug it, the only thing in the call stack is a Steam call. Steam.isSteamAccountNameInUse I think it is...

PS - It's not my legitimate copy, it's a friend's...and it might have been purchased in Hong Kong

Read full topic

Well, with that edit it works just as well as it ever has for me, that is, a range of results from "not at all" to "barely" without unobfuscating with Zelix, which isn't really an option. Actually it worked worse than usual - it left me with a "" instead of removing the last statement.

As for why it stopped working, I don't know...I'm too busy trying to bypass Steam in order to play a legitimate copy of Half Life 2 on my no-inet computer to bother debugging a transformer at the moment. Valve sucks - why 'protect' your game to the point where it's nonfunctional?

item.title: PotentialFieldControlFinder
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Krichevskoy:

[quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=3436.msg41004#msg41004 date=1149027749]
[quote author=Krichevskoy link=topic=3436.msg40959#msg40959 date=1149023559]
I haven't actually checked yet, but did you perhaps make it search more than just the application's main class? That's the simplest problem I can think of that it might be.

That's how I got it to work without error, yes...I didn't post anything since I had no idea whether what I did totally messed up the deob. I'm still looking through it, but I just told it to scan every single class for the potential fields instead of the just main class...do you think that would just screw up the deob or anything?
[/quote]

Well, the criteria it uses are pretty broad, so it might. Turn on DEBUG and see how many final fields it comes up with. There should only be one.[/quote]

It comes up with a ton of potential fields, but only one for the main field and the other field value.

main field = FIELD[client.fb.Z]
field = FIELD[client.fb.Z]

The strange thing is that the field it finds is in the client.class...the main class (I would assume...I haven't checked that code yet). So I don't understand why it didn't work before.
